comment._content:
The Louvre is visible, but only a sliver of it between two buildings. This is taken at the bottom (south) of the avenue de l'Opera. 

The people on horseback are probably part of the Republican Guard and not police as such. Although I'm not familiar with the uniforms of the period.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: The Louvre mentioned in the caption may actually be the Hotel du Louvre, which is located at Place André Malraux. There is a partial sign, if you look closely at the building with the red flag in the background. The uniformed soldiers appear to be French Republican Guard. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Republican_Guard Here’s an image of the Guard from circa 1900, www.jamd.com/search?assettype=g&assetid=3307923&t... Thanks! We’ll use the information to update our catalog record.
